intro: Tylophora oblonga, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Tylophora oblonga is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
